intro: Hieracium dublitzkii, commonly known as the Dublitzki's hawkweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its yellowish to reddish flowers and is native to central and eastern Europe. The plant typically grows in meadows, pastures, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates. It has basal leaves that are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Hieracium dublitzkii is often found in open habitats and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural areas.
